bibl.title: Greek historians in Cairo
bibl.note: I. Thucydides' papyri. The finding and preservation history of 6 fragments from Oxyrhynchus (P. Cair. Inv. 41084; 47408; 47459; 47499; 47993a; 68898 = Pack2 1522; 1536; 1510; 1521; 1505; 1509). - II. Xenophon's papyri. A fragment of the Anabasis and a fragment of the Memorabilia (P.S.I. XI, 1196 [= P. Cair. Inv. 68899]; P. Cair. Inv. 45622 = Pack2 1542; 1560).

bibl.title: Egyptian Museum Collections around the World, Band I

bibl.seg: IPPOLITO Flavia and Natascia PELLÉ, Greek Historians in Cairo.
Mamdouh ELDAMATY and Mai TRAD (Edd.), Egyptian Museum Collections around the World. Studies for the Centennial of the Egyptian Museum, Cairo. Volume I (Cairo, 2002) pp. 569-579, 2 figg.

I. Thucydides' papyri. The finding and preservation history of 6 fragments from Oxyrhynchus (P. Cair. Inv. 41084; 47408; 47459; 47499; 47993a; 68898 = Pack2 1522; 1536; 1510; 1521; 1505; 1509). - II.
